snippet: The sale marks the exit of the Finnish utility from the electricity distribution business after earlier sales of grids in Norway and Finland.
abstract: Finnish state-controlled utility Fortum announces agreement to sell Swedish electricity distribution network to Borealis Infrastructure Management and consortium of Swedish funds for 6.6 billion euros, or around $6.9 billion, including debt.
lead_paragraph: The sale marks the exit of the Finnish utility from the electricity distribution business after earlier sales of grids in Norway and Finland.

headline.main: Fortum Agrees to Sell Swedish Power Distribution Grid for $6.9 Billion
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Finnish Utility Sells Off Last Electricity Grid
